benchmark_details.name: K-Viscuit (Korean Visual and Cultural Interpretation Test)
benchmark_details.overview: K-Viscuit is a benchmark dataset tailored to Korean culture, developed using a semi-automated framework that combines human-VLM collaboration. It focuses on evaluating vision-language modelsâ€™ cultural understanding through visually grounded multiple-choice questions.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: The primary objective of K-Viscuit is to evaluate the cultural understanding capabilities of vision-language models within the context of Korean culture.

data.source: Web images and human annotations, using Wikimedia Commons as the primary source.
data.annotation: Annotations were generated through a semi-automated framework combining VLM-generated questions and human verification.

methodology.calculation: Accuracy was calculated based on the percentage of correct answers selected by the models from provided options.
methodology.interpretation: Higher accuracy indicates better cultural understanding and recognition of visual cues associated with Korean culture.
methodology.validation: Validation was performed through a combination of human verification and empirical evaluation against existing models.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.data_licensing: Images sourced under Creative Commons licenses.
